one_reviews_text: Absolutely delightful. Excellently constructed environments, with an appropriate and immersive score to go with them. One of the most polished VR experiences I've encountered.

This is a masterpiece, it delivers the puzzle in an outstanding way, I can't imagine the amount of resources  it takes to put all those pieces together..... This is a wow wow game, nothing can deliver this better than VR, it works flawless with my Quest with link... Pls make a sequel  Form 2,3,4 and 5
Its good and easy nice Puzzles BUT a hour of gameplay is a Joke? Early acces or a tech Demo not more...

This is more of an experience than a game. Cool environment and good showcase of how light and sound can impact an environment. Bought it on sale and wouldn't pay full price, maybe $5 or so. Puzzles weren't very hard but visually enjoyable.

This game is more like a work of art than a game. Each level was designed out of this world amazing! Although the puzzles were fairly easy and it is only about 30 minutes of gameplay, it left me wanting so so sooooooo much more! I really hope we get a FORM 2 with more intricate puzzles and longer gameplay. Even if you don't like puzzles, I recommend trying this experience anyway because it truly is a visual masterpiece.

This game isn't so much a game as it is an experience.
A truly mesmerizing visual style, combined with incredible soundscapes and beautiful sci-fi visuals, creates a masterpiece of epic proportions.

Absolutely worth the price, and then some. 

I only wish it were longer so I would have more to enjoy!

Quite the imaginative experience.  Puzzles are light enough not to cause frustration, but interesting enough to delight the soul. 

The visuals!  The VISUALS!! And the SOUNDS!!!   

21/10 would transcend again.

Yes it is a short experience....but it was amazing to say the least.  The visuals, the ease of play....all was perfectly natural.  I can only hope that they will make this into a full-fledged game.  Comes on sale often though so get it then.  I got it for just under $10.00CDN.

Well done!!!!!

UPDATE:  This game is still quite amazing and I love it to pieces.  However are there any plans to bring it to the Quest?

review_title: Not as compelling as it could have been
one_reviews_text:
Short experience. Mostly interacting with knobs and buttons from a static position.
Quite repetitive and boring unfortunately. Had some good concepts but failed to follow through for me.

I found FORM to be an easy pick-up-and-play game. The puzzles were intuitive and I found them to be enjoyable. The graphics and scenes are an excellent demo on what VR should be like. The only downside is that the entire game is easy to finish and most will find themselves wanting more even after it's over.

An excellent title to pick up if it's on sale. I'd recommend it. To the devs please consider expanding upon the base game and adding in new scenes or alternative additional puzzles to enjoy. Thanks.
A dreamy work of art from start to finish.  Great graphics, intuitive movement and well designed puzzles.  Quite short, and taxing but not difficult, hopefully a taste of something more to come.

I enjoyed playing Form, its nicely made and puzzles emply VR nicely. But when I finished I was like... aha, now the real game starts. But not, it was already over. 
 So 3 starts not for quality, but for way too less of a content.

I love it, to short, I want more!
Really great puzzle game, currently one of my favorate VR games that I purchased, and it was very reasonably priced.
I can only hope for a FORM 2 !!

Very short, though it's absolutely beautifull! 
great little app to show someone the amazing world of VR

Just wish there was more to it,  the puzzles are easy to solve, but yeah the whole game is just so short, but worth it when on sale.
Great graphics, trippy effects - nice simple puzzles.. Very immersive, worth it for the sale price

review_title: One of the best VR experience
one_reviews_text:
One of my best VR experience, visual effects are so beautiful, i don't know how they could imagine such a thing ! Very immersive, puzzles are not very hard so not frustrating. A must have in your lib to convince people to come into VR ! thank you to developers for their quick answer to my problem ;)
Please add french support ..! and we want more !!! too short !!!
Localization/translations would be great...! (french for me)
The visuals and audio are super cool, nice little puzzles.

Visually stunning game with exceptional level and audio design. The puzzles are simple and logical, the only one I really didn't like was assembling the mirror because I first thought I had to attach the parts to the pedestal. But maybe I'm stupid, I don't know. The "chord" puzzle, on the other hand, was one of the best experiences I've had so far in VR. There's no real story to the game, even though there are hints. It leaves a lot to the imagination of the player, which is fine for me. Overall, a definite recommendation to everyone who's new to VR. Get it in a sale, it's well worth 10 Euro (or the equivalent in your currency.)

review_title: Good intro to VR, but limited as a game
one_reviews_text: I found FORM to have great visuals. If you are brand new to the VR, its a great experience. It's still good if you've used VR for a bit, but the puzzles are fairly limited and the gameplay short. I finished this game in a single 1 hour session.

Graphics, audio, atmosphere, mechanics, puzzle variety and difficulty were all about perfect for me. As mentioned in other reviews, the only bad things are the length and the story resolution. It only took me about 30 minutes to play through. I played it twice to make sure I didn't miss anything and even went to watch walk through videos on youtube to make sure. There is what appears to start out as a very in depth story which never gets resolved. I'm glad I played it but also very glad I got this on sale. Hope they add to the story with updates or another episode or something.

The game design is wonderful and the controls are very easy to understand and work with...after all they are just hands. The puzzles had been very fun but the largest disapointment for the price I paid even on sale is that the game just ends. For me I cannot give more stars because it took me about 25 minutes to complete all the puzzles and then I played it a second time thinking I missed something only to complete it even faster still. If they add onto the game at no additional charge I would gladly play it more but at this time I wish I could get my money back as BANG for BUCK is not there at all for me.

First - this kind of puzzle games is not my cup or tea. But it was in a sales package and so I played it. I liked it.

But it's very short - it took me like 1 hour and I didn't hurry. And you cannot really play it differently afterwards, it's a linear puzzle game - so repeating it doesn't give you anything.

On the positive side, it feels very polished and has great visuals and sound! The alien designs and effects, some organic  moving tech stuff, just great. It wasn't boring - but it's short. More like a 1 hour concept / art demo then a real game, just like many VR games right now. The puzzles are quite easy, just try poking around and it gets clear quite fast.

All this short games are just too expensive when they are not on sale. Compare this with a tripple A game for 50 euros...for weeks and weeks of fun.

While i will admit that the style and soudtrack are amazing the actual content of the game is very lacking. All of the puzzles that i encountered in the game were so simple and straightforward taht i honestly was rather bored when i actually tried to solve them. The game's ending is rather abrupt as well and answer's none of the questions that were raised during the experience. While i will give credit to the devs for the style, soundtrack and being able to make a game like this with a fairly small team, i would still say that this game is not worth the $15 price tag.

tl;dr
Pros: 
Facinating intro sequence
Great atmosphere
Good graphics
Mesmerizing soundtrack

Cons:
Very easy difficulty
Incredibly short
Leaves things unresolved
A little overpriced for what you get

This is an exceptional audio and visual tour de force. After a brief sequence in the regular world, it takes one into an extremely abstract environment with one physics/audio interaction puzzle after the other. I'll be honest: Usually as soon as i hear puzzle and VR combined, i often get turned off. Why? Because there is nothing more frustrating to me than being in VR and getting stuck on something and not being able to progress, it gets annoying and boring to me way more quickly than already for regular screen content, since i'm in that different space and want to explore and experience something progressing, not get stuck in the same area with no way to go on.
But this is great in all puzzles besides one for which i had to look up the solution.
(one has to move sliders to the right level, totally random seeming)
But all others?
They are a masterclass in how to design fun intuitive user interfaces on a level of its own. Presenting something which is intentionally entirely mindwarpingly different and alien and at the same time also so excellently designed that the solution almost instantly presents itself with the most intuitive interaction attempt one would try and which all responses of the system guide one towards.
Visual and audio cues are forming a mesmerizing constant feedback loop.

I could go on and on praising such aspects.
All those i love and again, they are exemplary besides one small exception.

Now the two aspects i did not like which took away from it a bit:
1.: Despite being (besides one exception) very well designed, there is no aid for when one would actually get stuck. 
2.: The story was not resolved at all, while initially it felt like uncovering a mystery, it was left all unended, maybe i missed something which would wrap up the story but that was a big letdown.

Still a great thing to experience.

review_title: Soooo beautiful, but yet another puzzle
one_reviews_text:
For the 5 millionth VR puzzle game out there, it’s by far the best. The mechanics of animations of the puzzles will blow your mind. It’s absolutely beautiful too.

I can’t play it again because I’m getting puzzle sick from all the million VR puzzles out there, puzzling the puzzle piss out of my puzzletiss. See? No fun when you hear the same thing over and over with a tiny spin on it.

review_title: Nothing really like in it VR
one_reviews_text: There really isn't anything like this out there... very abstract puzzle solving game with great mechanics and great graphics. Its a standing experience that takes roughly an hour and isn't ever too difficult. Does a GREAT job of showing off what VR can do. I got it on sale but would say its worth the full 15$

The game looks spectacular, but none of the puzzles are even remotely challenging, and the story is barely an introduction which ends super abruptly with the game after two hours of gameplay. It's a really cool experience, but a totally underwhelming game.

The game lasts about an hour or so, and is really an experience as much as it is a game. Honestly, by the end of the hour I'd about had enough of it, but it was a pretty cool hour, so the length of it is about right. I would definitely recommend it to a friend. Also, I found it to have a pretty high comfort level, and I get VR sick pretty easy.

This reminded me of The Room in VR.  It's a short, but fun experience.  You're a scientist playing around with a Monolith and get pulled into it's little world where you solve various puzzles, most of them experimenting with mechanical contraptions.  You can get through it within an hour or so.  I've enjoyed going through the experience a couple of times.  Well worth the money as it's VR done correctly.

review_title: Really fun. Less than an hour long...

one_reviews_text: This is by far the best experience I've ever had in VR. Totally worth the money.
It is one of the best games I every played in VR. Very creative and the visualization is excellent. Thanks for the whole team who created!
Beautiful game. We need more please.

review_title: very good and worth the money!
one_reviews_text: This is perfect if you love surrealistic worlds: It feels like you're trapped in the black hole of the movie Interstellar. The riddles are selfexplaning and it's fun to solve them. And even without solving, it's a great experience to just view the area because the graphics are just astonoshing.

The big takeaway for me was quality over quantity. It might only take you 1.5 - 2hrs to get thru this, but this game transports you into the story's world. The design of the puzzles & environments were well thought out. As I was going through it, I was thinking "how do you even come up with this stuff"? Thank you too the devs for bringing this into the world!!!

Finished it in 2 hours. It is a puzzle game with visually satisfying animations of different geometry shapes you fit together or manipulate with your hands. The story has shortcomings and is only moved forward during a very small part of the time you play.

review_title: Phenominal Puzzler left me wanting more.
one_reviews_text:
For me, Form is one of the best puzzler games in VR I have played. The design of the puzzles with the surrounding scenes changing shapes had me captivated. 

The only real setback was how short the game actually is. I was able to get to the credits in about an hour and a half.

Over all well worth the money.

This would actually be a two stars, but I feel someone has to counterbalance the huge and injustified praise this game gets. While it is an interesting environment, very claustrophobic and dark, the game is so so easy that it's painful. I raced through the puzzles, the story was incomprehensible and felt like it was stuck together cheaply. And worst of all it was really short, finished it in one hour. 
If anyone has ever played The Room 1 and 2, it's much better and so much longer (unfortunately it's not in VR). 
Not recommended for more than 5 Euro.

I loved the visuals and soundtrack of this game. The puzzles were challenging but not too time consuming. It would be great if this game was longer, I was able to get to the credits in 30 minutes or so. As such it felt like a really high quality demo. Length aside, it is a very well made experience. I was really immersed in the atmosphere.

This was an incredible mind jerk. I wasnt sure if I was playing the game or if the game was playing me.  This was one of the most incredible experiences that I have had in my LIFE.  I actually forgot that I was playing a "game" from time to time and felt myself in the afterlife wrapping up this journey with a series of logical tasks given by aliens, angels or some more intelligent/higher power.  Not only did each puzzle/task have to be figured out but the games (puzzles) force you to figure out that you need to figure it out!  The only thing that I suggest to the devs is to give us MORE! The graphics were intense. Great job!!!

The visuals in this game are breathtaking and so creative. You have to puzzle your way through it, but they're fairly easy - just hard enough to be sastifying. 

It's pretty short, but I completely enjoyed the experience. Sequel please!

review_title: A very good puzzle room game
one_reviews_text: It's not long and you can pass it in less than an hour. Atmospheric, immersive, very interesting. I played it on high with my modest rig - FX-8350, 16Gb and GFX 1060 and I did not get any issues. I would love to play a few more games like this.

Seriously wtf was that? It was awesome whatever it was.

This is short. Like I spent an hour playing through it. But the experience was pretty awesome. Very good graphics, lighting, and sound. This was well done but I hope there is a lot more of stuff like this in the fuiture! Nice job, devs!

As others have said, this is a very immersive game and one that is very rewarding.  The puzzles aren't overly difficult, and the animations and story that progress after finishing a puzzle are really cool.  If you like being challenged then I would pick this up.  It took around 90 minutes to complete and was great the entire way through.

If you've ever played "The Room" series on iOS, think this with immersive sound design, more mystery and the feeling of BEING in 'the room'. This is a very well done game and you can tell the devs put a lot of love and passion into this. Very polished. I have to say one of the things that shines on the Rift is when dark scenes are done well - scenes that utilize the OLED screen to really immerse you in real darkness. This game does that so well. Can't wait to play through it again to complete the second ending.

I really wish it was longer. Takes less than an hour to complete (not rushing it) but its a very enjoyable hour. I bought it on a sale for $5 - funny enough, I can actually refund it as I've played less than 2h :) not going to. I really hope that more games (hopefully longer ones) like this will be created.

review_title: The best VR experience I have had so far
one_reviews_text: I loved this game. Visually beautiful and well thought out, satisfying puzzles. A very well made and high quality VR experience. Definitely recommended.

As other people have said, this is exactly the reason I bought VR.  Extremely immersive, fantastic interactive puzzles, and beautiful graphics and sound!!

FYI, it says best in a 5x7 area, but I managed in a 4x4 with a little diagonal positioning.

I bought this game on the strength of the reviews and I've got to say it's more emersive than most games, quite relaxing and satisfyingwhen you complete a puzzle if you like puzzles that are not to hard but take a bit of thinking about get this game I had fun playing it I just wish it was longer but it does have replayability just to see if I can get through it quicker I do like this game highly recommended.

review_title: I bought VR for this kind of game but ..
one_reviews_text:
The game keeps crashing after 15-20 minutes of playing.
I feel so immersed but it keeps crashing.
I would like to send the crash log to a dev

The game itself is so relaxing, lots of sounds and lights. The puzzle are simple but this is not the purpose of the game in my opinion. There is a lot of mouvements and a lot of shapes that changes. I love it
review_feedback:
Hi CuisineTournante, 

Thanks for the kind words about FORM. I'm sorry you're running into problems with repeated crashing. If you can, please do send us a crash log at support@charmgames.com. We'll take a look as soon as we can.

Thank you!

review_title: this is what vr is made for
one_reviews_text:
thank you developers, you are one of the only ones out there willing to take risks and do something different, and non-formulaic. 

this is more than just a puzzle game, it is a beautiful experience that leaves you with a sense of mystic awe.

you aren't just doing the same things the whole game, it is like you are being tested on your rational intelligence by some higher alien consciousness. 

if you like puzzle games, geometry, sci fi, and surrealism, i think you'll really like this game. it might not appeal to some for it's artistic qualities, but that's their problem
Like a lucid dream.  intuitive puzzles, in the stile of the "room" games.  Hoping for a new chapter,  a little bit short for me.  Having said that, an amazing experience.
Exactly the reason I bought VR!  Not too long, but right for the price.  Incredible immersion!
Awesome and unexpected. Amazing visuals and ambiance. I just wish it was longer.

This experience is incomparable,  (literally) UN-Comparable more like, to anything I have seen.  I feel like I am ten again (I am 49) .  It has a bit of everyting, but not just thrown together,. Well done.. just Beautiful, Alien but Stranglely Familiar/again,.. LOL :)   I think I may have finished it in one sitting, but it is worth any price, and I'm certain will take normal people MUCH longer... ;~)  After a point, late in the experience (that was quite Musical!!! Bravo! Very Clever,..) I got to a point where it finally brought me back to the Lab where I started, it said I looked tired, and asked me if I wanted to cancel further experiemnts and see a Doctor or something,.. I said no and the room just sort of went into a null mode,  It might be the end? I  reloaded my saved game and this time answered 'Yes' to see 'therapist ?  and/but I immediately heard a loud NO! yelled at me, and then the same thing as before the room sort of in a null mode,..With credits I think n the menu,.. Maybe it is a further test?  I hop e thre is more but it was  LOT for the money, I'm very satisfied,  I will definately do it again, I was kind of play acting and being a 'WIZARD GUY' etc.,.. Whoosh this! and Zoom that!  Don't forget to stop and smell the transistors with your toes!   Very cool, very worth the price of entry, ALSO: VERY WORTH SHOWING FRIENDS Especially Smart Ones who happen to Scoff at 'VR"  HEHE.. As a Developer myself I can attest a LOT of work went into this, an almost ALIEN amount of work ;)  My only gripe, is I wish companies would hire a good Character Animator like myself and outsource their NPC's. They have Still Charatcer Cards and Still 3D Meshses for Characters, which in this work just fine, but, things I could design, develop, animate (with Lip Sync and believable acting) in just 1-3 days per character.  It makes SUCH a difference. I would even consider doing some character develoment/animation work just for Credit/Reference!  Robert, My Twitter: @NextWorldVR

Short, but a great visual experience and ambience.  Price isn't too bad, esp on sale.

Puzzles are sortof an adult version of those match the shape toys for little kids.  But way cooler than I make that sound :)

review_title: Very short but worth the price
one_reviews_text: As someone previously stated, you can complete the game in 1-2 hours.  However the gameplay and visuals are top notch.  I bought it on sale for 7.49 and it was definitely worth the price.  You would pay the same thing or more for a movie ticket or a combo meal at McDonalds - so I consider the purchase of this game to be money well spent.  One other thing I liked about it is that you can save/load multiple gaming sessions, which is not the case for many other games that I've played.  The game seamlessly auto-saves your progress at the completion of each puzzle. so you don't have to concern yourself with saving your progress.  Just take a seat and enjoy the experience.  I certainly would give this game a 5-star if it was longer and a bit more complex.  But in my option, the experience is worth the full $15 price and even more so at the sale price.
Really beautiful, blow your mind.

I loved every second of playing this. I just wish it was longer! Fascinating little puzzles, beautiful environment. The first game that's given me goosebumps multiple times while I was playing it. I'll be looking for a sequel!

It's kind of The Room but on LSD. There are a whole bunch of puzzles you need to solve in a virtual environment. It's clearly had a lot of work put into it and the puzzles are quite intuitive even though you have no frame of reference a lot of the time.

Takes between 1-2 hours to complete(i was actually very surprised when the end credits came up as i was expecting the next series of puzzles).
The puzzles,while quite fun are pretty easy.
Has a quite nice sci-fi mood to it,feels good to be inside the enviroments.
It's a reasonable time killer but just too short and too easy.
Not sure how much i paid for this,I'm sure it was fairly cheap as i got it in a sale but if i paid more the £5 i was definitely  short changed.
I wouldn't reccomend.

This is a must have. It is a wonderfully immersive game with beautifully visuals. The puzzles are all incredibly inventive and only possible in VR. It maybe quite short but every second has so much to give that it doesn't matter. Buy this game - you won't regret it.

This game was simply amazing 4/5 starts for how short it is though, If you like puzzles and vr this is the game for you. the puzzles are simplistic but the way it was exicuted was great experience giving the fact most of the puzzle game out right now have issues with tracking issues or need a masive play space this is great for people with small play areas.  Thanks to the creators of Form for this experience hope to see more.

Atmospheric puzzle game with excellent mechanics.  Everything you touch just "feels" right and works like you'd expect.  I even had fun just messing around with the physics at times (the strings of symbols are really cool).  I love the intricate way the machines expand and collapse.  Excellent sound as well.  Not very difficult or very long but a one-of-a-kind experience from a small team.
This isn't particularly difficult or lengthy but really atmospheric. Very polished and a different look to many games. Not scary at all, jusst slightly eerie in places. Worth your money.

Wow, I am amazed how atmospheric and fun this abstract puzzle game is. I can't wait to showcase it to my friends! The only setback is that the game is really, really short! If it was a few hours longer, it would get a 5! Looking forward to what the devs make next!

review_title: Beautifully done but WAY too short
one_reviews_text: Really loved the look and feel of the game but I was through it in maybe an hour and a half. Just when I thought I was finishing the first introductory level it was over.

I believe this belongs in anyone's Oculus Library if you are demoing VR to people.  This is not so much a 'game' or 'experience' as it is a demo.  It feels cool to interact with the different puzzles and see what happens when you do so.  I certainly enjoyed FORM; however, it is not a 'must-have' in my opinion.

This was my first puzzle game for the rift.  It offers a nice audio and visual puzzle experience.  It is pretty short and I'm not aware of any replay value. However, the game was fun from start to finish.

First the positive - I love the concept. It has it's own style and it is good fun puzzler game. It is very pretty too which I am a fan of.

Now the Negative - I beat the game in maybe 3 hrs. There are only two levels and each one has several puzzles in it. Maybe a few minutes per puzzle. Most if not all puzzles were too easy. The game should be at least double the size for the money if not triple. This seems to be where VR games are at now. The issue is there isn't replay ability like some of the shooters so it needs to be longer so you feel like you got your money's worth. Once you know the solve to the puzzle, not really worth playing again.

Over all - Game is pretty and unique. It is worth picking up but it won't take long to beat, like batman and like batman it is over priced for the size of the game. This is more of a preview to a full game. So for $5 - $8 it is worth snagging, but only going to get a couple of hours out of it.

The game gave me goosebumps after solving the last puzzle. 
Awesome atmosphere. Liked the puzzles a lot. Would really like a little bit more challenge but not "brain melting" hard. 
Awesome soundtrack.
I pick this one up on impulse while it was on sale and as others have mentioned it is short, but stunning to behold.  I played through in about an hour, but I'm not disappointed in my purchase.
It was a visually enjoyable and a medium level puzzle game, quite good.
A great surreal, albeit short. I like that there is no hand holding. You have to figure it out all by yourself.
I didn't know what to expect and still after solving each puzzle I still don't know what's coming next.  The beautiful visuals and sounds makes this a wonderful VR experience.
This is what i had always hoped VR would be like. Im not a puzzle kind of gamer, but this is unique. Visuals & atmosphere are STUNNING. Buy this!
The environments are intriguing and the puzzles are great.  I only wish it lasted longer!

I usually keep my reviews down to a couple of sentences. Not this time. I'm a real OG of VR. I've probably absorbed 200+ experiences over the last 3+ years. Where to start... 

The graphics are a Spinal Tap 11. The physics are pretty good. The hands could be dialed in for Oculus Touch better. They feel like they were designed for the Vive or something. Like when you hold the coffee mug, the angle is off, but who gives a $#!+ because you guys are CREATIVE as f@^k!

I love Lone Echo, Grav Lab and Robo Recall and blah, blah, blah... But as a hardcore gamer, I've been waiting for THAT gaming company. Ya know? The 'Atlus', the 'Working Designs', the 'Platinum Games'... the outside the box thinking gamer company. You guys have that feel of a company to be watched. (Possibly worshipped, but you need 2-3 titles for that plivilege) Given the resources and time you guys could really blow gamers balls clean off. Girl balls too. 

I could sit here and nitpick at the game but I don't want to. I'm impressed. Everybody else is just doin' the same $#!+ ad nauseum... "Oh look! Another f@&kin' wave shooter! So original!" Getting sick of 'em. And so much content is just uninspired @$$.

Anyway... I'll stop gushing about the game and go get my nipples to chill out. VR needs more creatives like you. I hope you guys keep going. Ignore any hater reviews from #NeedsToGetAClue-istan. 

Thank you guys and gals,
A fan,
-Trick
Incredibly short. But incredible experience. Thank you :) Deffinately one I'll be showing friends and family.

To get it out of the way: this game can be completed in about an hour. Otherwise it's a really satisfying physical manipulation puzzle game. Puzzles aren't so much difficult as they are super compelling/satisfying due to the way things unfold/flip-around/fit-together/etc coupled with great sound. Very much enjoyed it and also think it'll become one of my standards to use when demoing.

It's not a long game, but the core concept is very interesting and worth a play. Basically touching things and seeing how these puzzle elements interact. I enjoyed it a lot, and would play more of the same if this developer made more.

Very nice puzzle game (graphics, atmosphere, immersion, audio and cool puzzles -> perhaps the puzzles could be a bit more difficult) ... and of course we want more! (but then again you cannot really expect a super lengthy VR-game in our current early VR-era in my view)

Surprised that this game is getting the high praise that it is. For a game that's advertising itself as a puzzle game there isn't much to figure out - most of the time seems to be spent poking and prodding things trying to find the interaction that the game is expecting of you. Many of the tactile interactions are not satisfying, they are fiddly. There's a frustration in knowing the answer to a puzzle and spending a seemingly long amount of time having to input that answer, like filling in a crossword with a pen that's running out of ink.

A very nice concept and some nice mechanics in there, the few puzzles that did require figuring out were good, and the graphics were nice. For the most part though, it's too simple and frustrating to play in places.
Thank you for creating FORM

Beautiful and atmospheric + clever little puzzles involving Touch + well polished production = an incredibly immersive experience. Really enjoyed this game. I'd love to see more like it.

Definitely on the short side, but that's ok. Along the same lines, the story felt like a prologue to something potentially far more epic.

I enjoyed this game. As others mentioned, just a little short, and the story kind of abruptly stops when you expect it to go on just a little more (maybe one more level?) - but overall, the time you have inside is spectacular. Puzzles aren't difficult, but they are visually satisfying and use the touch capabilities perfectly. More than the excellent visuals is the SOUND and Music playing around you. It brings it all together. Theres a great simple musical puzzle, not unsimilar to the 'simon' 4 color game. The game's not all that it could have been story wise, and I did have a few functional issues, at least I didn't see clearly how to stop mid-level and save game, and messed it up once having to start all over.. but no big deal. Ultimately, I say.. buy the game while its on-sale! For a short 1 hr, max 2 game, the music, visuals and easy puzzle nature are really time well spent.

Title says it all. Short experience that really showcases the breathtaking awe that is virtual reality. Soundtrack and visuals are simply amazing. However, if doing simple logic puzzles isn't your thing, then maybe this isn't the game for you. In any case, I'm pretty sure this was an homage to 2001: A Space Odyssey, which definitely increased my enjoyment of this game.

Brilliantly designed mechanisms coupled with gorgeous lighting and atmosphere. Puzzles are not very hard, but very cool. One good comparison to how it approaches puzzling would be the "The Room" games. The short length of 1-2 hours is a bit of a shame, but what a wonderful hour or two this delivers. This will become a staple for demo sessions from now on. Can't wait for a sequel.

Do you love puzzle games?  Then this may be the game if you're looking for an immersive, easy puzzle game.  Seriously, I finished this game in about an hour and none of the puzzles were difficult.  In fact, I solved several of them just by messing around.  You aren't told what to do, so part of the game is just figuring out what the puzzle is.  It's an immersive, innovative puzzle world, although the story lacks any cohesion (I still don't understand what happened).  Worst of all, the game ends suddenly.  I seriously thought I was going to the last chapter of the game, the last puzzle room and instead it was role credits.  WTF?  Well, for the content and price, I just can't fully recommend this game.  It's a very tepid recommendation if you like this genre and you are okay with a blah "story" and simple, yet immersive puzzles/atmosphere.  The biggest puzzle is actually the included VR soundtrack .. quite the mystery there :/

FORM is hard to explain. A series of gratifying interactive puzzles set in a fascinating and beautiful abstract world, where half the battle is figuring out what you are meant to be doing. It's original, imaginative, low pressure, high intrigue, and condensed. Great quality audio, visuals and mechanical animation throughout. FORM isn't a comfy familiar genre, and might not be for everyone. Yet the VR games scene needs far more of this kind of original experimentation. Push the limits, show me things I've never imagined, and let's see where we end up!

The game is great as a puzzle game, the atmosphere and soundtrack are simply perfect. The game is short but I think it's a decent length; what left me disappointed is the story, which is really half baked in a way that doesn't make any sense or addition to the experience, I would have preferred having either no story at all or a story with an ending that gives it some closure at least; overall I recommend it

Well I got to say, I loved this game, well polished and very immersive. Plays just like the Room on the iPad. If you like puzzles you will love this. The only down side is its short, but what you do get is like being in dream or another world in which you want to explore more and more, its all very trippy . Give it ago and with any look there will be a Part 2. ;-)
4 out of 5 only because of the length...  finished in about an hour.  Very cool Graphics, easy puzzles, but a lot of fun!

Sort of like "The Room" in VR. The puzzles are simple and not at all frustrating. The environments are well crafted  and the controls are mostly intuitive. 

I was able to finish in about an  hour making this game way too short. Also there was no real story to it. A story would have given this short game much more depth. 

Even at that, I enjoyed it and consider my money well spent.

Visually i find this game top notch.  The controls are simple so it's a great game to demo VR with.  The puzzles are fun though not hard, i enjoyed a lot of the visuals like the symbols teathered together you can swing them around and they make noise, fun little things like that made it enjoyable.    Not a lot of re-play value, but this is a great game to demo VR to friends.

review_title: No words can describe this world
one_reviews_text: The graphics, the design, the art is amazing but it's the sound that is always musical that takes the cake. I felt scared because it's a strange alien world, never seen anything like that in my life and never in movies or games. The puzles are fun and not frustrating, but you must be able to memorize up to 6 musical notes and not be color blind. The game last 1 1/2 hour if you rush into it, but you will want to play at least another session later. The only thing I do not like is the lack of finger and subtle motion the touch controller can provide. It's probably because the game was designed on the inferior HTC Vive PSMove immitation. One last thing, the objects in that game feel real and not empty cheap textured polygons, they have a mass and they have a quality feel to them.
A bit short but visually impressive. I loved it and would like to see more of these games

I just finished it, and I'm very happy that I gave it a try. The visuals are fantastic. The puzzles somewhat reminded me of The Room games, which is something I've wanted to try in VR for a long time. I only wish that the experience was longer!
The puzzles aren't organic, but it presents an interesting virtual world to inhabit for a short time.
I very seldom finish games.  Honestly, I usually lose interest.  This game was interesting enough to make me want more by the time I finished.  Good job guys.  It's short, but well worth the money.
This game is short but it's absolutely amazing. It's not just a game, it's an experience.
If anyone remembers Close Encounters of the 3rd Kind.  I imagine this game may have been inspired in part by that film.  Only complaint is it was a little short and the puzzles were mostly easy.
I feel this is more like  a demo.  Really short.  Puzzles not hard at all. Experienced puzzle gamers might look somewhere else. It is beautifull crafted but it lacks story and dept.
Better luck at decoding these puzzles.
Knew it was short going in, but I still thought there'd be a bit more of an ending/finale.  Still a great looking game/experience though.
Really fun puzzles and amazing visuals to go along with it!
This game was a blast! A bit short, but worth it.
Got it while on sale. Definitely worth the time.
Worth every penny!
Please follow the link below to see my 1st impressions of this cool VR puzzle game! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XO59cD5eKT0
Really fun puzzles and amazing visuals to go along with it!
This game was a blast! A bit short, but worth it.
Got it while on sale. Definitely worth the time.
Worth every penny!
